p: CCL includes both (a) cases where the claim is based on an established law, for which compliance/enforcement is sought, and (b) cases where there is no established law, but claimants assert that there ought to be (e.g. through expanding the scope of existing constitutional mandates, human rights statues, common law principals, etc). CCL has often been pursued through the international legal pathways of multilateral institutions and the United Nations system, drawing upon such doctrines as The Convention on the Rights of the Child, OECD Guidelines for Multinational Organizations, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, amongst others.
